page.title: 03Local History-East Leicester
page.content: {(cont.from p.2)}Eastwards farmland has been overtaken by modern council & private housing,schools & shops. The mansion houses have new roles. Evington Hall became a convent & is now a Catholic comprehensive school. Evington House is a sports pavilion & its estate a public park. Even some public buildings of the '30's & '40's have new uses,e.g The Lido,Scraptoft Lane,was a swimming pool,became a series of small factory units & is now a hosiery factory. The Trocadera cinema was pulled down to make way for a petrol station. Not only Wakerley's 'new town' but also the villages of Humberstone & Evington,once outside the city bounderies,have become urbanised & it is difficult to imagine them once being separate communities.
